intro: Leptaulus gossweileri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves with a prominent central vein and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white. It is a popular houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. Leptaulus gossweileri thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture and humidity to flourish.
